{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3318054,"name":"AgentSmith451","username":"AgentSmith451","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/agentsmith451/{size}/231133_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-26T18:42:45.438Z","cooked":"

Our team is using the AM 1 stage climber in a box with a 775 motor, sport gearbox, and ratchet sport mechanism.

Initially, the included pin for the pawl was loose enough in the housing that it repeatedly vibrated right out when the pawl was left in neutral. It’s since been replaced by a slightly larger roll pin (which fixed that issue btw, if anyone else has this same problem). The downside is the pawl is not as free as before as the hole in the pawl was not enlarged when the roll pin was installed.

Our robot doesn’t have pneumatics on it, so for actuating the pawl we are attempting to use a random servo motor with a small linkage. I haven’t seen it operate under load yet so I’m not sure how much force it’s actually going to take to actuate while hanging.

I’d like to have some other solutions ready to tee up for the students if the servo isn’t up to the task, what is everyone else using?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-02-26T18:42:45.438Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":124.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":456233,"topic_slug":"ratchet-sport-without-pneumatics","display_username":"AgentSmith451","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31049,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - Team 451 "The Cat Attack""},"post_url":"/t/ratchet-sport-without-pneumatics/456233/1","custom_user_title":"Mentor - Team 451 "The Cat Attack"","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3318070,"name":"","username":"pevvvvvvvvv","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pevvvvvvvvv/{size}/233321_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-26T18:55:01.330Z","cooked":"

I suspect the servo won’t cut it. I saw some similar servo failures in 2022.

Are you doing this to “lock in” your climb at the end of the match? If so, you should check out this thread which has a lot of good ideas. Good luck!

Also look at electric solenoid actuators. You might be able to get something strong enough under current rules, maybe not.

Yeah it’s just to engage the pawl on the ratchet to lock the climber

We use a spring to pull the paw to engagement and a servo to release (if need be) this has been our go to setup for years and it has never failed us.
